intro: Cheiridopsis pillansii, commonly known as the Pillans's ice plant, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy leaves and showy flowers. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically blooming in late spring. Its leaves are succulent, adapted to store water, allowing it to thrive in arid environments. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and low maintenance requirements.
